(not that I want any summoner spells to be removed, just they are more of a noob trap than revive)
Diversity seems to be a thing they are really struggling with this season as a whole...

I'd say that it's not like they aren't trying, but they're not really doing anything worth mentioning to bring diversity to League.  Something I, as well as others in the community have noticed is that they're removing the diversity we're begging them to keep, and begging them to communicate on.  

Their rational behind their choices are contradicting what they claim they want to do with the game, and it highlights their favoritism and vision for how THEY want the game to look within poor balance decisions. 

We want explanations from the actual balance team, not representatives trying put out the fire they started, and are throwing oil barrels onto.

Honestly, I play Clarity quite often on AP supports or midlaners with favorable matchups. {{summoner:13}} allows you to push/harass like crazy in midlane so you can gank other lanes without missing cs. Harass to the point that enemy has to recall, then roam. {{champion:115}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:161}}  are examples of champs I would use {{summoner:13}} on.

As AP support, (mainly pre-patch {{champion:26}} , but also {{champion:25}}  or {{champion:143}}) you can really overwhelm early levels. Again: force to recall, deny them farm, farm more yourself and help other lanes. 

later game the teamfights can go your way when everyone suddenly gets 40% mana.

My problem with this is the complete lack of context. Like, aren't they at least gonna explain why they thought it should be removed *now*?

I mean, clairvoyance and clarity are used about as much (read almost never here) and they are still in the game.

I agree, but they can't provide their reasoning because we can dispute every point they could make, so my guess is that they would rather not even try.  And admitting that would cause the same level of "WTF" reaction if not more than what the silence has promoted.
